values.content: You are a helpful, intelligent writing assistant.

Your task is to personalize an email.

You'll do this by taking, as input, a prospect LinkedIn profile, and then editing 5 templates for different sections of the email: subject line, icebreaker, elevator pitch, call to action, and a PS field.

Your templates are below.

Subject Line: "hey {name}, think I have something for you re: {uniqueThingAboutThemOrTheirCompany}"

Icebreaker: "I know you're doing {thing} and I've been following {relatedThing} for a while so I figured it made sense to chat"

Elevator Pitch: "The TLDR: I think I can add ~$5K/mo to {theirParaphrasedBusiness} with a few automated systems"

Call to Action: "I just did this for a very similar {industry} company and we hit $28,350 in a few months—they do {relatedThing}—so am very confident I can duplicate this at minimum. Would be 100% risk-free, I'd guarantee at least 20 appts booked or you wouldn't pay."

PS: "even if we just chat I'd love to hear about what you're doing with {thing}"

Guidelines:
1. Your tone of voice should be "casual bar conversation" and very spartan. No fancy language. 
2. Look for plausible (but vague) connections wherever possible.
3. Do not just repeat data from the LinkedIn profile verbatim. Paraphrase, so they think a human wrote it.
4. Make sure the subject line is non-capitalized, even if it's grammatically incorrect. This makes the email seem human.
5. Respond in JSON using this format:

{"subjectLine":"","icebreaker":"","elevatorPitch":"","callToAction":"","ps":""}
You're a helpful, intelligent administrative assistant.

I'm a business owner specializing in AI, automation, marketing, and software.

Below is an email request from a journalist looking for information about their story.

Your task is to determine whether it is relevant to me, and if so, draft an email body that answers their questions using my tone of voice (casual spartan).

If it is relevant, return a JSON object as follows:

{"relevance":"true","emailBody":"email body goes here","emailAddress":"their email if relevant"}

If it is not relevant, return "false" for relevance and leave emailBody blank.

--

Some information about me:

I own 1SecondCopy, a successful AI marketing company that does over $90K/mo. My name is Nick Saraev. Here are my links (don't use it unless asked):

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/nickolas-saraev
Instagram: instagram.com/nick.saraev/
Twitter: twitter.com/nicksaraev
Website: 1secondcopy.com
Headshot: i.imgur.com/8ZOtiGf.png

Use the following email template when responding to relevant inquiries:

"Hi {name},

I own 1SecondCopy, a successful AI marketing company that does over $90K/mo.

{your customized responses go here}

Will be in the office for the rest of the day - if you need anything, just shout & I'll take care of it.

Cheers,
Nick"

Make sure to respond in JSON!

---

Tell friends to join Source of Sources - It's always free! https://www.sourceofsources.com!

​

Want to know how to strengthen your relationship with journalists? It's no secret that journalists are stressed. This post from Muck Rack focuses on the challenges journalists have with work-life balance and steps that PR pros can take to become better partners with them.

​

Good morning! It’s Thanksgiving week here in the US! There won’t be an SOS on Thanksgiving Day, and only one on Friday. Here’s to a calm week! Queries this morning fro CBS News, Rocket Mortgage, GoodRX, Psychology Today, and others!

1) SUMMARY: Seeking healthcare/Medicare specialists to weigh in on how RFK Jr and Dr. Mehmet Oz might affect benefits/healthcare if appointed

CATEGORY: Business and Finance

NAME: Jordan Rosenfeld

EMAIL: jordan@jordanrosenfeld.net

MUCK RACK URL: https://muckrack.com/jordan-e-rosenfeld

MEDIA OUTLET: GOBankingRates

MEDIA WEBSITE: https://www.gobankingrates.com

DEADLINE DATE: 2024-11-25

DEADLINE TIME: 12:00 pm

TIME ZONE: Pacific Standard Time

QUERY: I'm seeking to speak to people (in a non-partisan way) about the possible changes to things like Medicare/Healthcare insurance and other offshoots of healthcare if RFK Jr and Dr. Oz are appointed. These are two stories. Please specify which you're commenting on (Can be both!). Robust/longer answers are prioritized--you must have relevant experience, and we will link back to your site. Please include pronouns.

Story 1: # Ways Dr. Oz Could Change Your Medicare or Medicaid Benefits if Appointed

Please try to answer the following plus adding your own thoughts.

-What is he likely to look to do, based on statements he's made, or promises Trump has made about Medicare/Medicaid?

-How quickly could these changes come to pass

-What alternatives would retirees have to deal with any cuts?

-Your additional thoughts

Story 2: # Ways RFK, Jr. Could Change Your Healthcare Costs, If Appointed

RFK Jr. has suggested some significant/sweeping cuts to the Department of Health and Human Services if appointed. Please answer, in addition to your own thoughts:

-What is he likely to look to do, based on statements he's made, or promises Trump has made about the HHS dept?

-How quickly could these changes come to pass?

-What should consumers expect in terms of changes/cost increases/availability or access to medicines, healthcare, vaccines, etc?

-Your additional thoughts

_____

CATEGORY: Business and Finance

NAME: Jordan Rosenfeld

EMAIL: jordan@jordanrosenfeld.net

MUCK RACK URL: https://muckrack.com/jordan-e-rosenfeld

MEDIA OUTLET: GOBankingRates

MEDIA WEBSITE: https://www.gobankingrates.com

DEADLINE DATE: 2024-11-25

DEADLINE TIME: 12:00 pm

TIME ZONE: Pacific Standard Time

QUERY: Working title: X Ways Elon Musk’s Plans for Government Efficiency Could Affect Your Retirement

This article is looking for well-informed speculation (with a non-partisan bent) over what Trump and possibly Elon Musk propose to do with a potential "Department of Government Efficiency"--this would be going after unapproved congressional funds initially. While this might not seem to have an immediate affect on retirement, it seems possible that federal programs like Social Security/Medicare or programs that fund seniors/low-income families could end up on the docket. Robust/longer answers are prioritized. You will get a link back to a legitimate site. Please include pronouns.

Please answer:

What are the most likely areas of potential cutbacks that could affect retirees?

Should retirees be worried about anything in particular, and what should they do in advance?

Could their efforts affect retirement, medicare, or any programs that benefit Seniors?

Other thoughts of yours?

_____

3) SUMMARY: Looking for gold experts to weigh in on why physical gold remains a smart investment

CATEGORY: Business and Finance

NAME: Sharon Wu

EMAIL: sharewritesllc@gmail.com

MUCK RACK URL: https://muckrack.com/sharon-wu

MEDIA OUTLET: CBS News

MEDIA WEBSITE: https://www.cbsnews.com/moneywatch/

DEADLINE DATE: 2024-11-26

DEADLINE TIME: 08:00 pm

TIME ZONE: Pacific Standard Time

QUERY: I'm working with CBS News to write an informative article about why physical gold remains a smart investment.

I need US-based experts (e.g. financial experts, numismatists, gold specialists, etc) to share unique insights.

Please don't message to pitch sources — if this is up, I'm still accepting pitches. I'm looking for helpful answers I can incorporate right away as we're on a tight deadline.

To be considered, please answer the following questions (all or the ones you can answer):

1. In your opinion, what are 3-5 reasons gold is a smart investment today, even with inflation and the price cooling a bit? Explain (the more in-depth the better here).

2. What specific economic indicators or market conditions suggest physical gold remains a strategic investment for 2025?

3. For investors new to physical gold, what allocation strategy would you recommend between bars and coins, and why?

4. What are the main pros and cons of investing in 1) gold bars and 2) gold coins?

5. What common misconceptions do you encounter about physical gold investment, and how do you address these with clients?

6. How should investors think about liquidity when it comes to physical gold, especially in today's market conditions?

Finally, please provide:

1) your role/title, a link to your LinkedIn profile, and company website

2) a good email to follow up if needed (MUST be the source’s email if you are a PR company/rep — if I don’t get the source’s email, I cannot use the insights)

IMPORTANT: We can’t accept/use AI-written responses, or responses you’ve already submitted elsewhere (we WILL check so please don’t waste anyone’s time). Also, I’m not looking for surface-level information easily found online. These questions are meant more as a guide to get more nuanced, in-depth expertise from you :) Please share relevant common hypothetical scenarios or client experiences to back up answers.

Thanks!

_____
